intro: Raffenaldia platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited raffenaldia, is a member of the Rhamnaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
